intro: Rosa afzeliana f. adenocalyx, commonly known as the腺萼玫瑰, is a botanical variant of the Rosa afzeliana species. It is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, particularly the enlarged and showy calyx that resembles a petal. This form is typically found in the wild in tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant produces fragrant pink to red flowers, which bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its unique floral structure makes it a subject of interest in both horticultural and taxonomic studies.
